metadata.title: CVE-2023-52678 on Ubuntu 24.10 (oracular) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:drm/amdkfd: Confirm list is non-empty before utilizing list_first_entry inkfd_topology.c Before using list_first_entry, make sure to check that listis not empty, if list is empty return -ENODATA. Fixes the below:drivers/gpu/drm/amd/amdgpu/../amdkfd/kfd_topology.c:1347kfd_create_indirect_link_prop() warn: can 'gpu_link' even be NULL?drivers/gpu/drm/amd/amdgpu/../amdkfd/kfd_topology.c:1428kfd_add_peer_prop() warn: can 'iolink1' even be NULL?drivers/gpu/drm/amd/amdgpu/../amdkfd/kfd_topology.c:1433kfd_add_peer_prop() warn: can 'iolink2' even be NULL?

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-52678` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.8.0-31-generic - 6.8.0-31.31
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-generic - 6.8.0-31.31
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-generic-64k - 6.8.0-31.31
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1008-aws - 6.8.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1007-azure - 6.8.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1007-gcp - 6.8.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-lowlatency - 6.8.0-31.31.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-lowlatency-64k - 6.8.0-31.31.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1005-oracle - 6.8.0-1005.5
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1005-oracle-64k - 6.8.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-6.8.0-1004-raspi - 6.8.0-1004.4
No subscription required
